page.title: 18HOMES IN LERRYN & BOCONNOC
page.content: Most of the houses in the area are over 100 years old.{Lerryn}is a {conservation area}so it is very difficult to get planning permission to build new houses. The homes are mainly{cottages}or {bungalows.}Many of the old buildings such as the{granary, the mill, old {warehouses, lime kilns}and{barns}have been converted into residences. There are some{council properties in{Lerryn,}which are either owned or rented by their occupants. The relatively{high cost}of property in Lerryn and Couch's Mill means that few young people can afford to buy it, so many of the houses have been sold off to people from other parts of the country, as {holiday homes.
